questions.question: What should you do when you walk through a troop of macaques?
questions.correct_response: That's right! Upon seeing a troop of macaques in your path, it is best not to make eye contact with them or smile as they may interpret that as aggression.
questions.tips: Clapping your hands strongly may also clear the way but make sure to keep your distance!

questions.question: What is the primary diet of a macaque?
questions.correct_response: Correct! Macaques primarily eat fruits and insects.

questions.question: If a wild boar suddenly approaches you, what should you do?
questions.correct_response: Correct! Some wild pigs have been conditioned to see humans as food suppliers. It is best to hide any food or snacks that you have out of their sight.
questions.tips: When you walk away slowly and calmly away from them, don't block their path as they may feel cornered
